column4: arggh...i've borked my system. Did an apt-get upgrade, rebooted, and now i dont have X.
i used to have nvidia-glx-legacy. tried reinstalling it- won't work
there is a bug in -16 kernel
might need to revert to -15, dont know the fix, there is probably an update now
i have no idea what -16/-15 has to do with the kernel-
or just make -15 your default in menu.lst
let me check-i think it could've have had something to do with xorg updates rather than the kernel - cause i didnt do dist-upgrade- a simple upgrade's supposed to keep the kernel intact, right?
i am unsure, i though upgrade would pull the kernel
i always use -> aptitude dist-upgrad, never even run plain aptitude upgrade
i'll remember that. well, i think its about to get fixed now- did an update and upgrading now
bad news. i think dist-upgrade is doing exactly what you advised me against- installing 2.6.20-16
well you can boot any kernel you like
yeah- i tried doing that just now- using 2.6.20-12
